images.title: Great Bowden: Great Bowden Hall by Nigel Cox, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Great Bowden Hall. Bowden Hall is a notable building in the village. It is a Georgian-style mansion that now operates as an event venue. The hall is set within lovely grounds and offers a charming backdrop for special occasions.

description: This Leicestershire based village lies just to the north of Market Harborough in the Harborough district of the county. The charming village includes many historical features including a noteworthy church dating back to the 13th century. For walkers there's some pleasant country footpaths and easy walks along the nearby canal. This circular walk from the village visits Bowden Hall before linking up with the Grand Union Canal. You can then follow the towpath into Market Harborough where you can explore the attractive canal wharf. The route then passes through the town before returning you to Great Bowden. You could extend the walk by continuing west to visit one of the higlights of the area at Foxton Locks. Here you will find an impressive staircase of locks set in a lovely country park.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village The Red Lion is a nice place for some post exercise refreshment. They serve fine food and also have a splendid outdoor area made from old shipping containers, recycled stable partitions and wooden beams. They have heated booths where you can enjoy views of the lovely Mediterranean Garden. It's a fine place to relax after your walk. You can find them on the Main Street at a postcode of LE16 7HB for your sat navs. The pub is also dog friendly.

display_address: 20, Main Street, Great Bowden, Harborough, Leicestershire, England, LE16 7HE, United Kingdom
